result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Areyona S Lebourgeois

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Areyona S Lebourgeois appeared by video.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal appeared by video for Areyona S Lebourgeois.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Areyona S Lebourgeois in court.  Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court for Areyona S Lebourgeois.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing.
For reasons set forth in the record, defense counsel requests additional time.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court, defendant Areyona S Lebourgeois not in court, in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
Case in court for calendar call. Defendant is in custody at MSDF. Court orders stayed bench warrant cancelled.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for plea and sentencing.  No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 30.  Calendar call scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Areyona S Lebourgeois in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Calendar Call. DEFENDANT APPEARS. Court canceled stayed bench warrant. 
Discussion held to determine the posture of the case. Defense counsel in receipt of discovery and offer and requests plea and sentencing date.
Case adjourned back to Branch 30.  
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal in court.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference. No appearance by the defendant.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 30.  Calendar call scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Areyona S Lebourgeois in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Areyona S Lebourgeois appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with all Macy's in Milwaukee County, WI.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 04/03/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Areyona S Lebourgeois in court.  Mark Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 4/1/22 @ 1p
